intro: Vasconcellea pentalobis, commonly known as the five-lobed wax plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with five lobes and its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Vasconcellea pentalobis is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display.
